DataElementConcept.preferredName: Central Nervous System Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic Surgical Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Abnormal growth of cells that comprise the tissues of the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord), without designation of benign or malignant nature.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance._Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Central Nervous System Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Abnormal growth of cells that comprise the tissues of the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord), without designation of benign or malignant nature.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm that affects the brain, meninges, or spinal cord.  Representative examples of primary neoplasms include astrocytoma, oligodendroglioma, ependymoma, and meningioma.  Representative examples of metastatic neoplasms include carcinoma and leukemia.
A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Permission to Release DEC granted by primary curator in 8/2008.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Procedures that may be used to obtain biospecimen(s) from participants that may or do have CNS cancer

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: combine the         Surgical procedure in which  tissue is obtained using either computed tomography or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). The procedure is done in awake (usually sedated) patients or under general anesthesia. For either computed tomography or MRI, the lesion is imaged in reference to a frame attached to the skull, from which stereotactic coordinates are computed for selected target points.  The technique combines the advantages of FNA (no scar, no anesthesia, inexpensive), excisional biopsy (acquisition of solid pieces of tissue rather than smears) and needle localization (precise guidance by x-ray or ultrasound imaging).
Surgical removal of a part of a lesion; some portion of the lesion is detectable on post-operative evaluation.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of a part of a lesion; some portion of the lesion is detectable on post-operative evaluation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.
